title.value: The load planning and sequencing problem for double-stack trains
title.justification: The title of the paper is directly provided at the beginning of the document.
title.quote: The load planning and sequencing problem for double-stack trains

extractions.description: This paper addresses the integrated load planning and sequencing problem (LPSP) for double-stack trains in intermodal terminals. It proposes two integer linear programming formulations to solve this problem and demonstrates their effectiveness through numerical studies. The study highlights potential reductions in container handlings and shows significant improvements in efficiency when using gantry cranes and reach stackers.

type.justification: The paper conducts an extensive numerical study and analysis, which is characteristic of empirical research.
type.quote: We show by an extensive numerical study that we are able to solve instances with up to 50 containers with a commercial general-purpose solver in less than 20 min.

name.justification: The research focuses on optimization problems related to load planning and sequencing, which falls under Operations Research.
name.quote: Even though this a relevant operational problem, it has seen no attention in the operations research literature so far.

name.justification: The research deals with intermodal transportation and logistics.
name.quote: This paper addresses the integrated load planning and sequencing problem (LPSP) for double-stack trains. This decision-making problem occurs in intermodal terminals.

name.justification: The paper discusses the use of Integer Linear Programming formulations as a method for solving the research problem.
name.quote: By extending prior work on load planning, we propose two different integer linear programming formulations.

name.justification: The case study in the paper is based on real data provided by the Canadian National Railway Company.
name.quote: A case study based on real data provided by the Canadian National Railway Company highlights that the LPSP can reduce the number of container handlings in intermodal terminals.

referenced_paper_title.justification: There is no specific title of a reference paper for the dataset mentioned.
referenced_paper_title.quote: A case study based on real data provided by the Canadian National Railway Company highlights that the LPSP can reduce the number of container handlings in intermodal terminals.
